results.title: Really Rosie
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Riss, Weston Woods Studios and Maurice Sendak
results.brief_description: Based on books by Maurice Sendak with music by Carole King. Convinced of her limitless talent, Rosie sweeps the neighbourhood Nutshell Kids into the spotlight of her pretend movie. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Reality therapy and discipline at home
results.creator_credit: Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Help for parents”.
Designed to provide ideas for developing parenting skills to help young people evaluate their behaviour and to plan more acceptable alternatives. Dr William Glasser interviews Tom McGuiness presenting the basic practices used in the Parent Involvement Program at the Institute of Reality Therapy, Educator Training Centre in Los Angeles. Demonstrates how each step is applied in the parent-child relationship.

results.title: Reality bites : sex, STDs and contraception
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australasia and Liolja Davis
results.brief_description: This program explores sexuality issues for young people, highlighting sexual identity, sexual diversity, relationships and communication, sexually transmitted diseases and contraception. Understanding sex and sexuality is a key component addressed in the program, as is decision making, being sexually active, practicing safe sex, and dealing with unwanted pregnancies.

results.title: Reality bites
results.creator_credit: Jersey Films, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg and Ben Stiller
results.brief_description: Reality Bites is Ben Stiller’s directorial debut, and one of the more mainstream offerings in the array of films that emphasized the “Generation X” phenomenon. Lelaina is a recent college graduate out on her own and independent from her supportive, but out-of-touch parents, facing the realities of careers and relationships in the adult world. She can’t stand her internship under a local television personality, and is forced to choose between Michael, a well-intentioned music-video network executive, and Troy, a brooding, sensitive slacker. Meanwhile, she must also protect the artistic integrity of her video documentary that depicts the everyday lives of her friends and herself. Cast includes: Winona Ryder, Ethan Hawke, Ben Stiller, Janeane Garofalo and Steve Zahn.

results.title: Realisation
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Scott Percival and ACMI
results.brief_description: Scott Percival thought he and his friends from Legacy were going to Perth for a little R&R. While he didn’t get the rest he’d hoped for, he got more than he could have imagined.

results.title: Real wild child: Australian rock music & culture 1950's-90's (PC & MAC)
results.brief_description: A wild, surreal, multimedia ride through five decades of Australian rock music, focusing on seven major eras. Stroll to the milkbar to experience the music of 1956-63. Sneak into a girl’s bedroom to find out what was happening there between 1964-68. Take a trip to the hippie’s house to discover the meaning of music during 1969-73. Front up to the TV studio to study the impact of what unfolded between 1974-77. Circle the perimeter of the room at the Hotel to get the low-down on the happenings of 1978-83. Gatecrash the nightclub to observe interesting phenomena occurring between 1984-89, until finally hauling your tired body into a deck chair in the 1990’s garage to conclude the exploration. Fabulously presented, with informative snippets of information, excellent graphics and soundtrack, as well as cameos by some of Australia’s most well known (and often notorious) identities. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: For Windows, 486 DX2/66 or better (Pentium recommended) running Windows 95 (recommended)/NT 4.0/Windows 3.1, 16 megabytes or more of RAM. Double speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended), sound card (stereo 16-bit recommended), 640x480 Super VGA display (256 colour or better). For Macintosh 68040 or better (Power PC recommended) running Mac OS System 7.5 or later. 8 megabytes if application RAM, (ie. memory available after System requirements) double speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended), 640x480 display (256 colour or better).

results.title: Real inside
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Douglas MacDonald, David Verrall, John Weldon and Derek Lamb
results.brief_description: Meet Buck Boom—dynamic, forceful and creative—and a candidate for the job of executive assistant at a staid corporation. There’s no doubt in Boom’s mind that he’s the person for the job, but the question is, can he convince Mr. Mudgin, the personnel manager? For, you see, Boom is a cartoon and Mudgin is not used to dealing with someone who is “different.” Skillfully crafted, using an innovative combination of live action and animation techniques, this hilarious short film probes stereotypes, prejudices and hiring practices.
